label: Description
value: Exterior decorated with two groups of three figures, each with central figure of woman holding vessel. Palmettes at handles. Interior centered with fretwork medallion containing woman facing seated man with staff.

label: Description
value: Globular body. Neck with flaring rim joined to strap handle attached to shoulder. Narrow band reserved in buff at the base.
Study for "Penn's Treaty with the Indians"

label: Description
value: Sketch of William Penn, with arms extended, surrounded by a group of Quakers, Indians, and merchants.

value: Graphite, pen and ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Leverton Harris, London, England; 1915: acquired by the Museum
Christ and the Woman of Samaria

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle, depicting Christ and the Woman of Samaria at the well in front of a  landscape including palm trees and architecture in the background. Printed on blue ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. J. Woodward Haven

label: Description
value: Rectangular, with convex raised sides, pierced; a) has two cast brass handles. Black field, painted in color with scattered flowers.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1915: acquired by Museum.

label: Description
value: Rectangular, with indented quadrant corners. Hinged cover with three circular pierced designs. Elaborately shaped hinge riveted on back; shaped plate with engraved scrolls and armorial bearings riveted to front face. Four cast feet in shell form, one at each corner. At either end, repoussé plate in form of mascaron, to which handle is attached.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1915: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Oval, with straight spout and shaped handle. Brown field, with decoration in gilt of festooned foliage. Contains muslin bag for tea leaves.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1915: acquired by Museum.

label: Description
value: Rectangular glass panel withshaped engraved borders on matt ground surrounding engraved subject of the youthful Virgin standing with the seated Saint Anne over the legend: "S. ANNA MAT. M. V."; within narrow scrolled frame of gilded wood.

label: Physical description
value: Engraved and silvered glass; carved, gessoed, and gilt wood

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Rectangular glass panel with shaped engraved borders on matt ground surrounding engraved subjects of Pope Julius II seated above a figure probably representing the evils overcome by his reforms; over the legend: "S. JULIUS PONT. MAX."; within narrow scrolled frame of gilded wood.

value: Engraved and silvered glass, carved, gessoed, and gilt wood

Puck, Study for Manufactures and Liberal Arts Building, World's Columbian Exposition, Chicago, IL

label: Description
value: Figure of a boy with butterfly wings, a star on his head; left leg raised, foot held out behind; right arm held out to side, left arm crossed in front of body as hand holds rein. Concentric lines indicate curve of dome. Squared for copying.

value: Charcoal and graphite on cream wove paper

value: Woman kneeling on right knee, drapery across thighs; head bent backward; left arm raised to hold framework for sphere, right arm extended across body.  Below, sketch of a cat. Squared for copying.

value: Charcoal and graphite on cream wove paper

value: Woman kneeling on right knee, drapery across thighs; torso bent backward; left arm raised, right arm extended across body; study of left hand, in which rests portion of a staff, at upper right.

value: Charcoal and graphite on cream wove paper

value: Draped figure of a woman seated on a stool, seen from below level of ground line, turned half-way toward left.  Across knees a folio, to left corner of which hand is held, while right hand rests on a telegraph key.  Center line drawn through figure.

value: Black chalk and graphite on off-white paper
The Morse Code, Study for Manufactures and Liberal Arts Building, World's Columbian Exposition, Chicago, IL

value: Draped figure of a woman seated on a stool, seen from below, turned half-way toward left.  Across knee a folio, to left corner of which hand is held, while right hand rests on shelf. Squared in red pencil for copying.

value: Charcoal and red pencil on cream wove paper
The Telephone and the Ticker, Study for "Electricity as Applied to Commerce," Manufactures and Liberal Arts Building, World's Columbian Exposition, Chicago, IL

label: Description
value: Outline of a pendentive with draped female figure. The figure's left arm is raised, holding a telephone receiver to her ear. In the background, a ticker, from which come two strands of tape wrap around the figure and end in the basket to the left. The composition is scaled and marked for transfering the image. Squared for enlargement.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, graphite on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: J. Carroll Beckwith, New York, NY; 1915: acquired by Museum
Study of Pendentive Figure for Electricity, Dome of the Manufactures and Liberal Arts Building, World's Columbian Exposition, Chicago, IL

label: Description
value: Outline of a pendentive with woman in green shirt and red skirt.  Left arm raised, left hand holding telephone receiver to ear; right arm at side.  Behind, to right, a ticker, from which come two strands of tape that are wrapped about figure and then end in a waste-basket to left.  Gold background.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and oil, gold tone on canvas
Studies of Hands for Dome of Manufactures and Liberal Arts Building, World's Columbian Exposition, Chicago, IL

label: Description
value: Sketch of the left side of the torso of a woman in a sleeveless garment, pointing with left arm extended at level of shoulder; three studies of hands to right.

value: Almond-shaped platter decorated near border with gilt, blue, red, and green flowers and abstract mounds. In well, an oval with overlapping initials: “LHW” (?).

label: Description
value: Two horizontal rectangular plaques (a, b) with three cast figural busts attached; one cast figure removed from plaque a.  Two vertical rectangular plaques (c, d) with triangular tops; incised decoration depicting standing robed figure holding book(?).  Holes for attachment to casket-shaped chasse core (e).  Parts a/d) gilt worn; losses to inlaid champleve enamel.

value: part a/d: gilt metal, enamel; part e: wood

value: Vertical portion of paper giving portion of a repeating design. Hawking party on horses, with attendants on foot, and dogs; castle in background, and serpentine framework of foliage.

label: Description
value: Printed cotton with a repeating design of laurel branches with a scroll which reads "The Constitution must be Preserved," on a background sprinkled with stars. Printed in brown, tan and pink on an ivory ground. Printed in support of the Constitutional Union Party's presidential candidate, John Bell, in 1860.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave Label: cotton printed by engraved roller

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Frederick F. Thompson

label: Description
value:
Printed cotton with a repeating design of two clasped hands with the words "The Union Forever" surrouned by a wreath of flowers, on a ground sprinkled with stars. Printed in red on a white ground.
The Union Forever was printed for Abraham Lincoln's second Presidential campaign in 1864.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave Label: cotton printed by engraved roller

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Frederick F. Thompson

label: Description
value: Embroidery sampler with border of stylized trees; alphabet in capitals and small letters at top; a cabin and trees at bottom; and verse.

label: Description
value: Long collar made of pieces of embroidery, lined with white silk and edged with metal lace; the embroidery shows flowers in colored silks and bands and ornaments in metal thread.

label: Description

value: Reproduction textile inspired by French eighteenth century fabric in the Cooper Union Museum collection. Design has figures in Chinese costume fishing in a small boat with water lilies and other plants on a black ground.

label: Description
value: Reproduction textile inspired by a French eighteenth century example in the Cooper Union Museum collection. Design has figures in Chinese costume fishing in a small boat with water lilies and other plants on a blue ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: compound satin weave

label: Description
value: Dark blue and beige reproduction textile inspired by a sixteenth century example in the Cooper Union Museum collection. Design has a large-scale symmetrical design of a flower-filled urn surrounded by scrolling bands with perching peacocks. Warp threads vary slightly in tone to simulate the appearance of a historical textile.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: compound satin weave

label: Description
value: Dark red reproduction textile inspired by a sixteenth century example in the Cooper Union Museum collection. Design has straight rows of circles connected by notched bars. Each circle has two concentric rings of small checkerboard patterning and is filled with scrolling lines. Between circles are diamond shapes with palmettes and vine patterning.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: compound satin weave

label: Description
value: Reproduction textile with a design of paired birds and dogs standing over a foliate ogive. Adapted from from the Cooper Union Museum collection.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: satin compound weave

label: Description
value: Reproduction textile adopted from a Lucchese design in the collection of the Cooper Union Museum. Dark red with metallic gold threads in a pattern of serpentine branches with ogive blossoms and Chinese-inspired monsters and senmurvs between serpentines.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal thread Technique: plain compound satin

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 64.7 x 64.5 cm (25 1/2 x 25 3/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Reproduction textile samples adopted from a Lucchese design in the collection of the Cooper Union Museum.
